The father of our country, George Washington, famously called the Constitution ‚Äî which his wisdom helped craft and guide to fruition ‚Äî ‚Äúthe guide which I never will abandon.‚Äù 

We owe it the same fidelity in this case and all others.
If the electors for the office of the president were not in question, neither would be the election certificates of my colleagues present here today.
While the Constitution and the 12th Amendment do not make Congress the judge of the states‚Äô presidential electors, it does require us to be the arbiters of the elections to this body.
I believe our body should vote on the certification of those members to ensure the integrity of the House of Representatives is guarded from all suspicion of illegitimacy.

Today, I objected to the seating of my colleagues from six states: AZ, GA, MI, NV, PA, and WI.

It would confound reason if the presidential results of these states were to face objection while the congressional results of the same process escaped public scrutiny. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eq1__QXW8AMXfP4.png http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eq2AG3NXcAMVwM4.png

I know there are solutions within reach if we work together. We may not always agree but over the next two years my promise to North Texans, whether you voted for me, against me, or not at all, is that I will always try to match your commitment to service with my own.

For Cal, the grade school student who wrote to me after the El Paso tragedy urging me to take action against senseless gun violence, I will never stop fighting to make our communities, schools, and places of worship safer for all of us.

Texans like Shane from Garland who despite having a good paying job struggles to afford her insulin. For Shane and every other North Texan faced with the impossible choice of rationing their prescriptions, I'll continue my fight to lower prescription drug prices.

As I begin my second term, I know we still face big problems as a state and as a nation and that we can tackle these challenges by working together. I'm grateful for the North Texans who have shared their stories with me and begun the work of building a more perfect union.

It's been the honor of my life to represent North Texas these past two years and I'm so proud of all we've accomplished together. From establishing a VA hospital in Garland, to passing the USMCA, and all I've learned at the many town halls in between, I couldn't be more grateful.

Today, because of the countless volunteers and voters across North Texas who believed that if we put our values first, and work hard to deliver results, anything is possible, I was sworn into my second term representing #TX32, the district where I was born and raised.

It's important to understand the context of the "Listen, all I want to do is this, I just want to find 11,780 votes" line.

It comes 40 min into the call, after Raffensperger has destroyed each fraud claim, and right after Trump makes the reference to jail time.

In the audiotape, Trump claims repeatedly that a 2020 settlement agreement bans the checking of signatures on absentee ballots and legalizes something he calls "ballot harvesting"

Neither of these claims are true. Absentee ballots have to be signature checked in Georgia.

In the tape Trump insists there are 4,500 illegal votes of people who left Georgia, registered in other states, and then moved back to Georgia, registered and voted.

The Secretary of State's team politely explains that yes, sometimes people move away and then move back.

On the phone call, Trump says there were 5,000 dead people who voted in Georgia.

There were 2.

When Raffensperger presses Trump on the 5,000 number, his crackpot lawyer says....get ready for this...that there are 5,000 voters who have the same name as someone who died recently.
